page.title: 12Great Brickhill Church.
page.content: Great Brickhill Church (Mary the Virgin) was built in 1218. When it was built it was lopsided but it was safe and stable so they did nothing about it. 250 people can fit in the church at the same time,and the church is always packed with this many for Christmas eve carol service. The church has a chancel and it has one step seperating it from the nave. Although the floor is bigger than the height of the walls the church was built tall for strength and beauty. The church was built tall so that the tower could be used to inspect the village in times of strife. All the columns in the church are Normans columns. The east window is the biggest. The church was more important in the life of the village when the village was ruled by the Manor than it is now.
